metadata.Title: CVE-2021-25214 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In BIND 9.8.5 -> 9.8.8, 9.9.3 -> 9.11.29, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.13, and versions BIND 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.11.29-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.13-S1 of BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.11 of the BIND 9.17 development branch, when a vulnerable version of named receives a malformed IXFR triggering the flaw described above, the named process will terminate due to a failed assertion the next time the transferred secondary zone is refreshed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19').
